dt: {bc}to lower often as a sign of respect or submission

et: Middle English {it}valen{/it}, partly borrowed from Anglo-French {it}valer{/it} (short for {it}avaler{/it} "to lower") & partly short for Middle English {it}avalen{/it} "to let fall," borrowed from Anglo-French {it}avaler{/it}, verbal derivative of {it}aval{/it} "downward," from {it}a{/it} "to" (going back to Latin {it}ad{/it}) + {it}val{/it} "valley" {ma}{mat|at:1|}, {mat|vale|}{/ma}
shortdef: to lower often as a sign of respect or submission

et: Middle English, borrowed from Anglo-French {it}val{/it}, going back to Latin {it}vallēs, vallis{/it}, of uncertain origin
